intro: Calycophysum, commonly known as the sea lettuce, is a type of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its flat, blade-like structure and is typically found in coastal waters and estuaries. The plant exhibits a simple thallus with a single layer of cells, which allows it to absorb nutrients directly from the surrounding water. Calycophysum plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms. It is also used in some traditional medicines and as a source of bioactive compounds.
